abstract: Gagra Journal; Amra International hotel in Gagra, Georgia, is experiencing something of renaissance, with every one of its 240 rooms booked through summer and many remaining  occupied until October; city is located in breakaway Abkhazia region of Georgia, area heavily reliant on Russian tourism but with no desire to be annexed by Moscow.

headline.print_headline: Bad Pipes, Stunning Views and a Tourism Renaissance
headline.main: Bad Pipes, Worse Service: A Soviet Riviera Jewel Is Reborn and Booking Up

snippet: After a long slump that began with the collapse of the Soviet Union, a once exclusive sanitarium along Georgia’s Black Sea coast is enjoying something of a renaissance....
lead_paragraph: After a long slump that began with the collapse of the Soviet Union, a once exclusive sanitarium along Georgia’s Black Sea coast is enjoying something of a renaissance.
